origination.corpname: Ann Arbor Junior Chamber of Commerce (Mich.)

did.unittitle: Ann Arbor Junior Chamber of Commerce records 1936-1985
did.abstract: Ann Arbor chapter of the Junior Chamber of Commerce, a young adult community service organization; minutes, project files, budgets, newsletters, photographs, and related material.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

did.physloc: Portions located in offsite storage; prior notification required for access.

acqinfo.p: The bulk of the records came from the organization (donor no. 6628); other materials came from Katherine Simon Smith (donor no. 5234).

accruals.p: No further additions to the records are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Ann Arbor Junior Chamber of Commerce records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: The United States Junior Chamber (Jaycees) (according to its website) "gives young people between the ages of 18 and 40 the tools they need to build the bridges of success for themselves in the areas of business development, management skills, individual training, community service and international connections." The Ann Arbor Junior Chamber of Commerce was organized in 1935

scopecontent.p: The record group consists of seven series: Administrative Files, Projects, Auxiliary, Topical Files, Publications, State and Local Jaycees, and Other Materials.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.corpname: Ann Arbor Junior Chamber of Commerce (Mich.)

Community service.
Fund raising.
Pumpkins.
War bonds and funds.
World War, 1939-1945.

scopecontent.p: The Administrative Files series documents the Ann Arbor Junior Chamber of Commerce's organizational functions including: executive meetings, finances, membership administration, and correspondence.

did.unittitle: Notebook with minutes, budgets, and newsletters 1961-1962
Notebook including minutes, newsletters, and financial 1964-1965
Notebook containing photographs, newsletters and miscellanea, 1964-1965

scopecontent.p: The Projects series documents the various initiatives the organization was involved with, showing their diverse range of activities.
The Auxiliary was the women's branch of the Chamber of Commerce when the latter was only for men. Since the organization is now co-ed, the Auxiliary no longer exists.

did.unittitle: Notebooks of minutes, finances, and activities
Michigan Association for Emotionally Disturbed Children 1964

scopecontent.p: The Topical Files documents various other initiatives and projects of the organization that were not substantial enough to be included in the other series. It also includes information on the awards and recognition honors bestowed by the Chamber of Commerce.

did.unittitle: "Basic Guide to Public Relations in Project Planning," 1972
Campaign of Ann Arbor Jaycees President 1974
Mid-America Institute Convention in Ann Arbor 1967
Polio Immunization Survey of the Mitchell School District 1959
"Ten True Stories Taken from Case Records," Ann Arbor Community Fund 1937-1941
Washtenaw County Citizens' Committee for Economic Opportunity

scopecontent.p: Various newsletters can be found in the Publications series, from the president's (Simon Sez) to the organization's own newsletters and bulletins.
The State and Local Jaycees documents some of the activities of the larger chapter's administration and other local chapters' projects and administration.

did.unittitle: Executive Committee and Board of Directors' minutes of meetings and agendas

scopecontent.p: The Other Materials series includes a scattering of photographs, a motion picture, scrapbooks of clippings and other documents relating to the work of the Ann Arbor chapter during World War II.

did.unittitle: Photographs and film of the organizations and its activities
